definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: He went to many restaurants, but all of them would only provide board without lodging.
sentences.chinese: 去几家餐馆都说是包吃不包住。

sentences.english: Where do the skin grafts used to create the canal and cover the ear come from?
sentences.chinese: 制造耳道及包住耳朵的皮肤由何移植而来？

sentences.english: High waist cutting and comfortable affixed to the abdomen.
sentences.chinese: 高腰式剪裁，完全包住且自然服贴于腹部不滑落。

sentences.english: Then, it should be covered completely with clean paper or cloth.
sentences.chinese: 保存时应用清洁纸张或布料把面包完全包住。

sentences.english: Saw his wife later, quickly hide pen boxes encase with books.
sentences.chinese: 看见妻子以后，迅速把笔盒和书一起包住藏起来。

sentences.english: Apply hot compresses to a boil.
The hills were enveloped in dense fog.
Bring up sides of foil, folding top and sides to make a tent.
sentences.chinese: 然后将箔片的顶部和边折起来包住这些东西。

sentences.english: Using the sketch as a guide, create the shape ofthe metal band that holds the bristles in place.
sentences.chinese: 以草图为参考，创建能包住刷毛的金属带。

sentences.english: But the small circle inside cannot be wrapped.
sentences.chinese: 但是里面的小圈不要被包住了。

sentences.english: Each seed is covered by a seed coat.
sentences.chinese: 每粒种子都由种皮包住。

definition: to wrap up/to bind up/bundle/parcel/package/CL:個|个[ge4]
to roll up/to curl up/(of dust etc) to swirl up
variant of 捲起|卷起[juan3 qi3]
to glue/to paste/to adhere/to stick to
to stick close to/to press up against
pad/cushion/mat/to pad out/to fill a gap/to pay for sb/to advance (money)
to draw (towards)/to be drawn to/to be sucked in
to draw together/to place side by side (e.g. one's fingers, two halves of a torn sheet of paper etc)
